intro: Arabis muricola, commonly known as the rock白菜 or hairy rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically found growing in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant features basal leaves that are lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually erect and branched. Small white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in clusters, blooming in early spring. It is a perennial species that thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature.
